MemoryInfobox.name: Up For Grabs
MemoryInfobox.description: 'A Treasure chest|chest of gold and silver sank. On learning that it might still survive and that Piracy|pirates were searching for it, a man asked for help finding it.'

General_Description: '''Up For Grabs''' was a virtual representation of one of [[Kassandra]]'s genetic memories, relived by [[Layla Hassan]] through the Portable [[Animus|Animus HR-8.5]].
Section_Description: A [[civilian]] sought the help of a [[mercenary]]. Kassandra answered.
Section_Dialogue:
Kassandra noticed a job posted on a [[message board]]. *'''Note:'''
''I offer great riches to anyone willing to help me recover them! Come see me.'' She sought out the civilian and addressed him. *'''Kassandra:''' ''You're the one who left the message on the board. What's going on?'' *'''Man:''' ''There's a [[merchant]] [[ship]] near the port with a [[Treasure chest|crate]] of [[gold]] and [[silver]] ingots, ''misthios. *'''Kassandra:''' ''You sound like you're plotting something.'' *'''Man:''' ''Someone got there before me. Cursed [[Piracy|pirates]] tried to take the boat. The chest must be on the ocean floor by now. The pirates are all circling, looking for it.'' |-|Destroy Pirate ships= *'''Kassandra:''' ''Sounds like I need to sink some pirate ships.'' *'''Man:''' ''That's exactly it. Will you do it for me?'' (Accept - I'll destroy them.) *'''Kassandra:''' ''I'll take care of it.'' *'''Man:''' ''Good. Be discreet.'' *'''Kassandra:''' Chaire'', stranger.'' Kassandra set out to destroy the pirate ships, and then returned to the man. *'''Man:''' ''Back already. Did you destroy them all?'' *'''Kassandra:''' ''It would be hard to piece them back together.'' *'''Man:''' ''Job well done, my friend. I believe this is yours.'' *'''Kassandra:''' ''That'll do.'' |-|(unknown)=
Section_Outcome: Kassandra did as the civilian asked, and was rewarded for this.
Section_Behind_the_scenes:
The dialogue for timed quests in ''[[Assassin's Creed: Odyssey]]'' is part scripted, part randomly generated from a pool of generic statements. As such, the wording encountered varies.

All timed quests have two variants, as noted: when given a choice, the desired is always the top one.
Section_References:
*''[[Assassin's Creed: Odyssey]]''

Structured_Dialogue.content: Kassandra noticed a job posted on a [[message board]].

*'''Note:'''
''I offer great riches to anyone willing to help me recover them! Come see me.''
She sought out the civilian and addressed him.
*'''Kassandra:''' ''You're the one who left the message on the board. What's going on?''
*'''Man:''' ''There's a [[merchant]] [[ship]] near the port with a [[Treasure chest|crate]] of [[gold]] and [[silver]] ingots, ''misthios.
*'''Kassandra:''' ''You sound like you're plotting something.''
*'''Man:''' ''Someone got there before me. Cursed [[Piracy|pirates]] tried to take the boat. The chest must be on the ocean floor by now. The pirates are all circling, looking for it.''
<tabber>
|-|Destroy Pirate ships=
*'''Kassandra:''' ''Sounds like I need to sink some pirate ships.''
*'''Man:''' ''That's exactly it. Will you do it for me?''
(Accept - I'll destroy them.)
*'''Kassandra:''' ''I'll take care of it.''
*'''Man:''' ''Good. Be discreet.''
*'''Kassandra:''' Chaire'', stranger.''
Kassandra set out to destroy the pirate ships, and then returned to the man.
*'''Man:''' ''Back already. Did you destroy them all?''
*'''Kassandra:''' ''It would be hard to piece them back together.''
*'''Man:''' ''Job well done, my friend. I believe this is yours.''
*'''Kassandra:''' ''That'll do.''
|-|(unknown)=
</tabber>
